title: Definitions
text: Recall that the mean of a dataset is the sum of every value divided by the number of values in a dataset. For example, the mean of 1,2,3 is $$\frac{6}{3}$$, or simply $$2$$.
speech: Recall that the mean of a dataset is the sum of every value divided by the number of values in a dataset. For example, the mean of 1,2,3 is  6 thirds , or simply  2 .
pacedSpeech: Recall that the mean of a dataset is the sum of every value divided by the number of values in a dataset. For example, the mean of 1,2,3 is   6 thirds

title: Solution
text: Knowing our definition, what is our answer?
speech: Knowing our definition, what is our answer?
pacedSpeech: Knowing our definition, what is our answer?
